required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laser Speckle Contrast Imaging Versus Infrared Thermography to Evaluate the Effect of Peripheral Nerve Blocks
clinical_study.official_title: Changes of Blood Flow Index Versus Skin Temperature for Evaluation of Peripheral Nerve Block: A Prospective Observational Study Using Laser Speckle Contrast Imaging and Infrared Thermography

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this prospective observational study was to evaluate the changes of blood flow index and skin temperature after the peripheral nerve blocks measured by laser speckle contrast imaging and infrared thermography, respectively.

detailed_description.textblock: Methods: Patients scheduled for elective surgery with peripheral nerve blocks will receive laser speckle contrast imaging and infrared thermography measures 5 min before the block and continous to 20 min after the block. The sensitivity, specificity of laser speckle contrast imaging and infrared thermography as diagnostic methods will be determined by receiver operator characteristic analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
primary_outcome.description: Changes of blood flow index determined by laser speckle contrast imaging

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
primary_outcome.description: Changes of skin temperature determined by infrared thermography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
secondary_outcome.description: Sensory block level determined by light touch and cold sensation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 20 minutes after block
secondary_outcome.description: Motor block determined by applicible score. For lower limbs use modified bromage score, for upper limb and other use muscle strength grade （Level 0: completely paralyzed, unable to do any free movement. Level 1: slight muscle contractions are visible. Level 2: the limbs can move in parallel on the bed. Level 3: the limbs can overcome gravity and lift off the bed. Level 4: movement of the limbs against resistance. Level 5: normal muscle strength, free movement）

arm_group.description: Patients scheduled for elective surgery with planned paravertebral block at any level will receive laser speckle contrast imaging and thermography measurements start at 5 min before the block and continoue to 20 min after the block. Chenges of blood flow index and temperature in the interested region including face and chest wall will be recorded simultaneously.

Patients scheduled for elective surgery with planned lumbar sympathetic ganglion block will receive laser speckle contrast imaging and thermography measurements at 5 min before the block and continoue to 20 min after the block. Chenges of blood flow index and temperature in the interested region including leg and feet wall will be recorded simultaneously.

Patients scheduled for elective surgery with planned brachial plexus block will receive laser speckle contrast imaging and thermography measurements at 5 min before the block and continoue to 20 min after the block. Chenges of blood flow index and temperature in the interested region including arm and hand wall will be recorded simultaneously.

intervention.description: Paravertebral block is performed at any level under realtime ultrasound guidenance with 20ml of 0.5% ropivacaine.
Lumbar sympathetic ganglion block is performed under realtime ultrasound guidenance with 20ml of 0.5% ropivacaine.
Brachial plexus block is performed under realtime ultrasound guidenance with 20ml of 0.5% ropivacaine.

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for elective surgery with planned paravertebral block for multimodel analgesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- With informed consent
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status Ⅰ-Ⅱ
- Undergo elective surgery with planned paravertebral block
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to participate in the study
- BMI＞35
- Those who had taken vasodilatory drugs before surgery
- Preoperative analgesic medications
- Any contraindications to peripheral nerve block such as coagulation abnormalities, allergy to local anaesthetics, peripheral neuropathy.

overall_official.affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice Director, Department of Anaesthesiology, Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College
